stories.title: You want Tor Browser ... not a VPN
New research outlines how longer lives are tied to physical activity

stories.text:
When searching for any kind of software or SaaS on your favorite search engine, you are bombarded with top 10 lists and unhelpful algorithm based comparisons.

I never know which are sponsored and even if they seem genuine, often times they are not that helpful (they don't compare the same metrics, highlight questionable advantages, ...).

Example: I was searching for a good log management tool. After 10 minutes of duckducking I found my self stuck in paralysis by analysis given the amount of options.

How do you search for the right tooling?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you compare software/SaaS in 2021?

stories.text: I would like to know what is used to develop a mobile app in 2021. I have a Java/Python background. I have seen Android tutorials but most point to Firebase, I wouldn't like to be tired to any ecosystem. Any pointers for example Kotlin with Mysql/Maria or Postgres db database. Any ideas welcome.
stories.title: What is used to develop Mobile App(Android/iOS) in 2021?
